title: Former Arsenal defender Thomas Vermaelen on life in Japan and thriving alongside Andres Iniesta and other ageing superstars at Vissel Kobe
text:
It is a hot, sticky day at the Ibuki Training Facility on the outskirts of Kobe in central Japan. On the all-weather pitches behind the main building, a group of players are engaged in a practice match; bibs against colours. Instructions are being barked in Japanese as the play switches from end to end. Suddenly, the ball is sent rocketing into the top corner by a sledgehammer of a left foot. “Ja!” roars one of the players. Lukas Podolski, the former Germany striker, wheels away clenching his fist.
